meanings.definition: Used as an exclamation to urge on hounds in hunting.
meanings.sent1: Yoicks! The hounds raced after the fox.
meanings.sent2: The hunters shouted 'yoicks' to encourage the hounds.
meanings.sent3: Yoicks! The hounds thought the fox was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: With a loud 'yoicks', the hounds dashed through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The sound of 'yoicks' echoed through the woods, spurring the hounds forward.

meanings.definition: Used as an exclamation of surprise or excitement.
meanings.sent1: Yoicks! I can't believe we won the game!
meanings.sent2: When she saw the surprise party, she exclaimed 'yoicks' in delight.
meanings.sent3: Yoicks! The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks lit up the sky, eliciting a loud 'yoicks' from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: Yoicks! The unexpected news left everyone in awe.
